meanings.definition: To move slowly and heavily, as through mud or slush.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog was sludging through the wet grass.
meanings.sent2: The workers were sludging along the construction site in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The snail was sludging its way to the finish line in the race.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be sludging along as we waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The thick mud was sludging under our boots as we walked.

meanings.definition: The act of moving slowly and heavily, as through mud or slush.
meanings.sent1: The sludging of the river made it difficult for boats to pass.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the streets were covered in a layer of sludging.
meanings.sent3: The sludging of the traffic was causing delays for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The sludging of time in the waiting room felt endless.
meanings.sent5: The sludging of the glacier was a sight to behold.
